title: Ryanair passenger forced to sit next to vomit on London to Dublin flight
text:
3
View
comments
A Ryanair passenger says he nearly became ill as he was forced to sit next to a pool of vomit for an entire flight from London to Dublin.
The budget airline apologised to passenger Noel O'Hare after a photo he posted on Twitter showed the revolting scene as he flew home on flight RYR113.
Noel said someone vomited on the floor on a previous flight, but it was not cleaned up before his one-hour journey to Ireland’s capital on Sunday.
Passenger Noel O'Hare said the pool of vomit was covered with tissues and left on the floor of the plane
Noel said the pool of sick in the row next to him was covered with tissues and flight attendants said it would not be cleaned up until the Boeing 737-800 landed in Dublin.
He told the Irish Mirror : ‘I had to sit next to vomit for an hour and a half, the plane was warm, the sick smelled and it made me heave.’

Share this article Share Noel immediately complained about the scene, sending a tweet to Ryanair’s verified Twitter account.
Quote: : ‘@Ryanair boarded flight FR113, looking forward to next 1.5hrs looking at vomit, was told will NOT be cleaned #filth’.
Ryanair said the vomit was not cleaned up as there was a shortage of cleaners at Gatwick Airport
Fellow Twitter users called the scene ‘disgusting’ and questioned whether Noel and other passengers were entitled to a refund.
Ryanair contacted Noel and offered an apology.
In a statement, a Ryanair spokesperson told MailOnline Travel: 'We sincerely regret this incident which was caused by a shortage of cleaners at Gatwick Airport, which would have delayed the return flight by more than one hour.
'The cabin crew blocked off the row of seats in order to minimise any delay to the return flight, and we apologise for any inconvenience caused.'
